text:
hello and welcome to Pai's Thailand food vlog once 
again where I show you the everyday Thai food

culture through just all the things that I eat on 
a regular basis while I'm here so today we're at a

restaurant called raw reua on soi Thonglor in Bangkok 
and we're having some interesting things here I'm

having and the first the most interesting thing I 
think today is the beverage this is I'm not sure

how to call it palm juice it's basically the syrup 
that they make palm sugar out of so when they make

palm sugar they basically take this and cook it 
down and reduce it down until it becomes sugar

but in its raw form it's actually a perfectly 
wonderful beverage in and of itself so it's the

nectar from the palm tree the sugar palm tree not 
the coconut tree and apart from that I am having

fried rice which is shaped like a upside-down boat 
because the name of this restaurant Calabria is it

means boat so it's a fried rice with dried Graeme 
fish so it's dried fish we use this fish lots in

our cooking and so you know it's very similar 
to my crab fried rice except its mate and and we

are sharing a beef salad or yummy YUM I've made 
this recipe on my website the beef is well done

however whereas mine healthier yak is medium and 
I think I remember making a point about how Thai

people just don't eat rare beef there you go very 
well done it doesn't even look grill to be honest

so might be a little bit of false advertisement 
and then my brother is having none other than

the infamous pad thai so that is PAP tie there you 
go short and simple I have a recipe for pot thai

for those of you here interested so when that's 
all for lunch today bye hi guys and for dinner

today we are having just a simple ish meal at home 
we've got right here a stir-fry of morning-glory

or sometimes they call it water spinach so it's 
just a vegetable side dish it's actually quite

popular this is called pot boom lots of garlic 
and chilies a curry made of bamboo shoots and it's

green because there is sort of a a juice of our 
particular leaf that we use to color and flavor

the soup green so that's why it looks like Popeye 
soup and then over here is Pat Kapow moon and so I

have a recipe for this in chicken in chicken form 
it's holy basil just stir-fried with some ground

pork and lots of chilies and a little pieces of 
long beans and then last but not least just plain

chicken stir-fry with soy sauce and pepper and 
it's just a very basic kind of like what do we do

with this bit of chicken let's throw it in the pan 
with some soy sauce so that's what it is so that's

our dinner and for dessert we're having something 
very simples a very simple dessert we've got some

Tokyo or mung beans mung beans boiled literally 
just boiled in sugar syrup and a little bit of

salt now mung beans is the same beans that I used 
to sprinkle on top of mango and sticky rice now

those beans are yellow and these are green because 
the shells are green this is what they look like

this is the color when they're unhulled and that's 
why a lot of people confuse them confuse them they

don't know that these are the two beans laning so 
that's that and so this is my little portion this

one's a bit overcooked so they're all kind of 
expanding and exploding but nonetheless it is

very good and then we're having also some mango 
this is a breed called maja tional and it's new

ish it is disappointingly sour so we are going 
to either sprinkle some salt on it or turn it

into a smoothie we'll see what happens to this 
sour mango and that is all for today goodnight
